content:
Hey! We have two forms of user profiles, and I'd like to chat a bit about what we call them.

  1. Screen-Shot-2022-11-03-at-4.03.01-PM.png

  2. Screen-Shot-2022-11-03-at-4.03.09-PM.png

I think the terms we currently use are:

Profile 1: Profile summary (help center), abbreviated to "Summary" as a column header in custom profile fields settings.

Profile 2: Full profile (link from profile 1), or sometimes just "profile" (see https://zulip.com/help/view-someones-profile).
(I haven't audited to see if these are 100% consistent.)

I don't love "profile summary", because I don't think that popup plays the role of summarizing the full profile, exactly.
I've been finding myself using "short profile" vs. "full profile" when referring to these, but I'm not sure that's great either.
I wonder if (1) should be called something totally different, like "user actions menu", or something along those lines?
"user details menu" is another option.

/poll What should we call the menu you see by clicking on a user's picture?
Profile summary
Short profile
User actions menu
User details menu
Please feel free to add more options, and to continue general discussion outside of the poll. :)
I think calling it just User profile will be easier to remember than giving it a name and forgetting to enforce it down the line.
So "user profile" vs. "full profile" (or "full user profile"?) would be the two terms?
Yeah, "user profile" and "full profile".
I kind of like the "card" idea; I threw a couple more variants into the mix.
I just added "User profile pop-up" after seeing a user use that term.
I like "user profile" and "full profile", but "user card" and "full profile" would also work well.

Maybe "user card" and "user profile" or
"profile card" and "full profile" are worth considering too. :thinking:
I added "User menu". I think I like other variants are probably better, though, since I think the avatar is likely to be the most memorable aspect of the popover in users' minds, not the menu items.

It depends on context, but in general I'd expect 'profile' or similar is not sufficient on its own, without 'user' being present.

eg. "View someone's profile" would seem to not strictly need it, since the 'someone' feels sufficient of a substitute (pronoun?!)

Hmm, so the "User card" option is still the most popular... If we go with that, I suppose what's currently called the "profile" or "full profile" could just be "profile", since there's nothing else with the word "profile" in it. That's kind of nice; "profile" is the term that felt natural when writing https://zulip.com/help/view-someones-profile.
Yeah, "View profile" would be a very reasonable label if this is a "User card".
I filed Use consistent naming for user (profile) menus #23530 with this proposal.
